catastrophic.definition: Any risk which could result in hundreds of billions of dollars in economic damage or lead to the severe harm or death of many individuals â€” this includes, but is not limited to, existential risk.

axes.name: Focused Attack
axes.description: A focused attack where the model is used to target one particular person/task

axes.name: Neutral Attack
axes.description: A neutral attack by someone with no particular expertise, trying to use it for this task

axes.name: Area Attack
axes.description: A single person running an area attack, leveraging the model to create large volumes of content / posts / emails / many attempts / brute force appraoch

categories.name: Cybersecurity
categories.description: Cybersecurity is focused on risks related to use of the model for cyber-exploitation to disrupt confidentiality, integrity, and/or availability of computer systems.

categories.name: CBRN
categories.description: CBRN is focused on risks related to model-assisted creation of chemical, biological, radiological, and/or nuclear threats

categories.name: Persuasion
categories.description: Persuasion is focused on risks related to convincing people to change their beliefs (or act on) both static and interactive model-generated content. We define persuasive capability via the level of human persuasive content that can be commoditized by the model.

categories.name: Model autonomy
categories.description: Model autonomy enables actors to run scaled misuse that can adapt to environmental changes and evade attempts to mitigate or shut down operations. Autonomy is also a prerequisite for self-exfiltration, self-improvement, and resource acquisition. Autonomy is all about the model's ability to do things on its own entirely like change its weights, purchase more server space, etc.
